item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is said that your life flashes before your eyes just before you die. That is true, it's called Life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The purpose of this lectchoor is to let you know where we are. We are in the deep cack. It couldn't be worse if it was raining arseholes. Any questions?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Real stupidity beats artificial intelligence every time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Gods prefer simple, vicious games, where you Do Not Achieve Transcendence but Go Straight To Oblivion; a key to the understanding of all religion is that a god's idea of amusement is Snakes and Ladders with greased rungs." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description:
"Most of the members of the convent were old-fashioned Satanists, like their parents and grandparents before them. They'd been brought up to it, and weren't, when you got right down to it, particularly evil. Human beings mostly aren't. They just get carried away by new ideas, like dressing up in jackboots and shooting people, or dressing up in white sheets and lynching people, or dressing up in tie-dye jeans and playing guitars at people. Offer people a new creed with a costume and their hearts and minds will follow. Anyway, being brought up as a Satanist tended to take the edge off it. It was something you did on Saturday nights.
And the rest of the time you simply got on with life as best you could, just like everyone else." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who <i>smiles all the time</i>." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Nathan add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Poetry might be defined as the clear expression of mixed feelings." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Nathan add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "May it not be that, just as we have to have faith in Him, God has to have faith in us and, considering the history of the human race so far, may it not be that ''faith'' is even more difficult for Him than it is for us?" -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Nathan add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Evil is unspectacular and always human, And shares our bed and eats at our own table ...." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Nathan add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description: "Some books are undeservedly forgotten; none are undeservedly remembered." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Nathan add a quote by W.H. Auden
item.description:
"<b>The More Loving One</b>
Looking up at the stars, I know quite well That, for all they care, I can go to hell, But on earth indifference is the least We have to dread from man or beast.
How should we like it were stars to burn With a passion for us we could not return? If equal affection cannot be, Let the more loving one be me.
Admirer as I think I am Of stars that do not give a damn, I cannot, now I see them, say I missed one terribly all day.
Were all stars to disappear or die, I should learn to look at an empty sky And feel its total dark sublime, Though this might take me a little time." -- W.H. Auden

item.title: Nathan add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "Soft as the earth is mankind and both need to be altered." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Truth never damages a cause that is just." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I object to violence because when it appears to do good, the good is only temporary; the evil it does is permanent." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others." -- Mahatma Gandhi
